meanings.definition: A metal fastener with a helical ridge, used to join objects together.
meanings.sent1: I needed a screw to fix the loose shelf.
meanings.sent2: He used a screw to attach the handle to the door.
meanings.sent3: The screw rolled off the table and into the toolbox.
meanings.sent4: She felt like a screw holding everything together in the chaotic room.
meanings.sent5: The shiny screw gleamed in the sunlight, holding the parts in place.

meanings.sent1: Please screw the lid on the jar tightly.
meanings.sent2: He had to screw the light bulb into the socket.
meanings.sent3: She tried to screw the cap back on the pen, but it wouldn't fit.
meanings.sent4: Time seemed to screw by slowly during the boring lecture.
meanings.sent5: The wind started to screw the umbrella inside out.

meanings.sent1: He tried to screw me out of my money with a fake product.
meanings.sent2: The scammer attempted to screw unsuspecting victims out of their savings.
meanings.sent3: She thought she could screw her way into getting a better grade, but the teacher caught on.
meanings.sent4: The con artist managed to screw the old lady out of her life savings.
meanings.sent5: The dishonest salesman tried to screw customers by selling counterfeit goods.

meanings.sent1: The screw patrolled the prison corridors diligently.
meanings.sent2: The new screw had to learn the routines of the prison quickly.
meanings.sent3: The screw confiscated the contraband smuggled into the prison.
meanings.sent4: The experienced screw knew how to handle the rowdy inmates.
meanings.sent5: The screw's keys jingled loudly as he walked down the cell block.
